thread.title: New Canaan ice hockey facing tough 2015-16 schedule
thread.title_full: New Canaan ice hockey facing tough 2015-16 schedule

author: Dave Stewart
title: New Canaan ice hockey facing tough 2015-16 schedule
text: Your Health New Canaan ice hockey facing tough 2015-16 schedule By Dave Stewart on October 13, 2015 in FCIAC , High School Sports , Sports , Sports Lead , Sports Schedule · 0 Comments The New Canaan Rams’ boys ice hockey team has a loaded schedule for the 2015-16 season, as they’ll square off against four FCIAC rivals twice each, and take on several of Connecticut’s top Div. I teams. The Rams will play a 20-game regular season, with 11 of those games counting as official FCIAC contests. The league has been reduced to 12 teams this year, as Stamford and Westhill have merged into a co-op team. The Darien Blue Wave, which won state and FCIAC championships last winter, is on the slate twice for New Canaan. The two rivals will play in a non-conference match-up on Tues., Dec. 29, and play the official FCIAC game on Sat., Jan. 30. Both games will be played at the Darien Ice Rink. The Rams will also have two games against three other FCIAC foes: State and FCIAC runner-up Greenwich, Ridgefield, and St. Joseph. The non-conference schedule is daunting, starting with the Notre Dame-West Haven Green Knights in the season opener at 6 p.m., Mon., Dec. 21, at Bennett Rink in West Haven. Hamden, Notre Dame-Fairfield, and Xavier — twice — are also part of New Canaan’s schedule. The Rams’ first seven games are all against Div. I teams. Following NDWH, the Rams will host Hamden, Darien, Greenwich, Ridgefield and NDFF, before opening the official FCIAC schedule against Greenwich at Hamill Rink on Jan. 11. Here’s the complete schedule: Mon. Dec. 21 Vs. Notre Dame-West Haven at Bennett Rinkm 6 p.m. Wed., Dec. 23 Vs. Hamden at Darien Ice Rink, 4 p.m. Tues., Dec. 29 Vs. Darien at Darien Ice Rink, 4 p.m. Sat., Jan. 2 Vs. Greenwich at Darien Ice Rink, 4 p.m. Wed., Jan. 6 Vs. Ridgefield at Darien Ice Rink, 8 p.m. Sat., Jan. 9 Vs. Notre Dame-Fairfield at Darien Ice Rink, 6 p.m. Mon., Jan. 11 Vs. Greenwich at Hamill Ice Rink, 4:45 p.m. Sat., Jan. 16 Vs. Fairfield co-op at Wonderland of Ice, 6:30 p.m. Mon., Jan. 18 Vs. Xavier at Darien Ice Rink, 2 p.m. Wed., Jan. 20 Vs. Ridgefield at Winter Garden Ice Arena, 8:30 p.m. Sat., Jan. 23 Vs. Staples/Weston/Shelton at Darien Ice Rink, 8:10 p.m. Mon., Jan. 25 Vs. Trumbull at Darien Ice Rink, 6 p.m. Sat., Jan. 30 Vs. Darien at Darien Ice Rink, 4 p.m. Wed., Feb. 3 Vs. Wilton at Darien Ice Rink, 8:10 p.m. Sat., Feb. 6 Vs. St. Joseph at The Rinks at Shelton, 6:30 p.m. Wed., Feb. 10 Vs. Norwalk/McMahon co-op at Darien Ice Rink, 8:10 p.m. Sat., Feb. 13 Vs. Westhill/Stamford co-op at Darien Ice Rink, 8 p.m. Mon., Feb. 15 Vs. Xavier at Wesleyan Universoty, 1:30 p.m Sat., Feb. 20 Vs. Trinity Catholic at Terry Conners Rink, 5:30 p.m. Mon., Feb. 22 Vs. St. Joseph at Darien Ice Rink, 6 p.m. The New Canaan Rams’ celebrate their 3-2 double overtime win against Fairfield in the FCIAC quarterfinals at Terry Conners Rink last season. — Dave Stewart Photo
